item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter: therefore, ye soft pipes, play on." -- John Keats

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "The work of an intellectual is not to mould the political will of others; it is, through the analyses that he does in his own field, to re-examine evidence and assumptions, to shake up habitual ways of working and thinking, to dissipate conventional familiarities, to re-evaluate rules and institutions and to participate in the formation of a political will (where he has his role as citizen to play)." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Arthur Rimbaud
item.description: "I turned silences and nights into words. What was unutterable, I wrote down. I made the whirling world stand still." -- Arthur Rimbaud

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "The block of granite which was an obstacle in the pathway of the weak becomes a stepping-stone in the pathway of the strong." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Junius
item.description: "All despotism is bad; but the worst is that which works with the machinery of freedom." -- Junius

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "We live as we dream--alone...." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Kevin J. add a quote by Mason Cooley
item.description: "Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are." -- Mason Cooley
